lines.gurmukhi: jYsy bn rwie prPulq Pl nimiq lwgq hI Pl pqR puhp iblwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Ban Raai Paradhulat Dhal Namiti , Laagat Hee Dhal Patr Puhap Bilaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as trees and other vegetation grow for fruits and flowers but as soon as they bear fruits, their leaves and fruits drop.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qRIAw rcq isMgwr Brqwr hyiq Bytq Brqwr aur hwr n smwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Treeaa Rachat Singaar Bharataar Hayti , Bhaytat Bharataar Ur Haar N Samaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a wife adorns and embellishes herself for the love of her husband, but in his embrace, she doesn't even like the necklace she wears as it is considered an impediment in their complete union.

lines.gurmukhi: bwlk Acyq jYsy krq lIlw Anyk suicq icMqn Bey sBY ibsrwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Baalak Achayt Jaisay Karat Leelaa Anayka , Souchit Chintan Bhaay Sabhai Bisaraat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an innocent child plays many games in his childhood but forgets them all once he grows up.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy Kt krm Drm sRm igAwn kwj igAwn Bwn audY auf krm aufwq hY ]405]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Khat Karam Dharam Sram Giaan Kaaja , Giaan Bhaan Udai Ud Karam Udaat Hai ?405?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the six forms of righteous deeds which are performed diligently for gaining knowledge, disappear like stars when the great knowledge of the Guru shines in its Sun like glory. All those deeds seem futile. Sagle karam dharam jug sodhe. Bin(u) nav
